rationale: The agent modified the wrong file entirely. The task explicitly requested changes to AuthorizationStatePersistenceUtils and TransformIndex files to reduce noise from transform persistence failures. Instead, the agent modified TransformPersistentTasksExecutor, changing logger.error to logger.warn for checkpoint-related errors (lines 269, 283, 328), not persistence failures. This demonstrates a fundamental misunderstanding of the task requirements. The agent changed 3 logger calls in the wrong file, while the ground truth changed 1 line in AuthorizationStatePersistenceUtils and 2 lines in TransformIndex. Completeness scores -1.0 because none of the requested changes were made. Correctness scores -0.3 because while the changes themselves are syntactically valid and follow the same pattern (error->warn), they target completely different error scenarios than requested and leave the actual noisy errors unchanged. Code reuse and best practices are neutral as the pattern used is appropriate, just applied to the wrong locations. No unsolicited documentation was added.
